meanings.definition: To surpass in performance or achievement.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outdo her previous best time in running races.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outdo their opponents and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the siblings led them to constantly try to outdo each other in everything they did.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication and hard work allowed her to outdo even her own expectations.
meanings.sent5: The student's determination to outdo himself pushed him to study harder than ever before.

meanings.definition: To excel or be superior to.
meanings.sent1: He always aims to outdo his classmates in academic performance.
meanings.sent2: The chef's signature dish never fails to outdo all other menu items in popularity.
meanings.sent3: The friendly rivalry between the two friends motivated them to constantly try to outdo each other in various sports.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity always outdo any material possessions she may have.
meanings.sent5: The artist's unique style never fails to outdo traditional techniques in capturing the audience's attention.
